text:
:eyes:  visibility regex ain’t quite working as expected. For example, if `my_required_field` is empty, then the field below shows.
```"name": "dependent_field",
...
"visibility": {
  "controlling_field": "my_required_field",
  "controlling_value_regex": "b"
}```
but if `my_required_field` has a value of `c`, then the `dependent_field` hides :thinking_face:
the IDE has “custom regex” AKA `MATCHES_REGEX` pre-selected – even when no operator is specified. So I assumed it wasn’t needed
spent a lot of time writing more complex regexes lol

Yea, it is a little weird that it doesn't set the default operator automatically when building from local. Funnily enough it seems to suddenly set it if you open the field while in design manager. When I first looked at the preview after coding it locally it functioned just as you explained, but after viewing the field in design manager it started functioning in preview as would be expected haha.

Is it possible to modify a module so that it can use more complex fields, like an accordion or a table? Based on my research so far, it seems like I can incorporate only simple fields, e.g. text fields, into a module.

It seems I can only add the field types that are available in the “Add Field” dropdown menu in the left-hand panel in the Design Tools/Design Manager.

Thank you!
